posts.post_content: I thought this guy wouldn't be very useful in limited...boy, was I wrong. It was unfortunately the only decent card I opened, but man did he do some crazy stuff. I did this at the end of my opponent's turn: [victim of night](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=victim of night), snapcaster mage, flashback victim of night. Then swung for the win. Epic stuff...can't wait to see what he does in my vesper control deck.

Posted By: Laguz (9/25/2011 6:41:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Gaffy00: No, it is, and will prove itself to be, the best card printed from this set.  
  
In fact, I am surprised at the 4.3 rating. The only reason it should be so low is people hating on the printing of such a powerful card.  
  
Just with some cheap spells, like Spell Pierce, Path to Exile, Vampiric Tutor, even Lightning Bolt, this card is very efficient. Do not forget that it can come out as a surprise-blocker and basically trade for an opponent's creature, while adding another effect.  
  
Expect to see a lot of these in decks, and very few in trade-binders.
posts.html:
@Gaffy00: No, it is, and will prove itself to be, the best card printed from this set.

In fact, I am surprised at the 4.3 rating. The only reason it should be so low is people hating on the printing of such a powerful card.

Just with some cheap spells, like Spell Pierce, Path to Exile, Vampiric Tutor, even Lightning Bolt, this card is very efficient. Do not forget that it can come out as a surprise-blocker and basically trade for an opponent's creature, while adding another effect.

Expect to see a lot of these in decks, and very few in trade-binders.

posts.post_content:
After pulling one in prerelease, this guy is absurdly powerful. You'd be a fool not to pick this first in draft, just bringing back something like [Rebuke](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rebuke) can completely change the face of the game.   
  
Just think what he'll do in Constructed. If you're going to pack a punch, may as well do it twice.

Posted By: SeiberTross (9/25/2011 12:19:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I don't think I'm the only one under the impression that if he didn't have flash, he'd be much less valuable. Sure, I can play it on my turn and [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment) again. But why not play it on yours, and [Negate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Negate) you out of the graveyard?   
  
And that's just the tip of the iceberg with this guy. Mark my words, Blue/White control, maybe even Esper control, will make you absolutely loathe this card.  
  
Why?  
  
[Venser, the Sojourner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, the Sojourner)
posts.html:
I don't think I'm the only one under the impression that if he didn't have flash, he'd be much less valuable. Sure, I can play it on my turn and Day of Judgment again. But why not play it on yours, and Negate you out of the graveyard?

And that's just the tip of the iceberg with this guy. Mark my words, Blue/White control, maybe even Esper control, will make you absolutely loathe this card.

Why?

Venser, the Sojourner
